moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bc4 h6: Perhaps a better pawn move would be a3 rather than h3. The real jeopardy is on the queen side of the board. a3 protects against pinning queen's knight to king later.
moves.5... b6 6. b3 g6 7. Bb2: Good fianchetto - moving bishop toward the outside of the board.
moves.7... Qe7 8. Nd5 Qd6 9. d4: A possible better choice would be 9.Nxf6  Qxf6 10. Bd5 Bb7 11. Bxc6 Bxc6 12. Bxe5. Then Queen moves to give up the h8 rook.
moves.9... Bb7 10. dxe5 Qb4+ 11. c3 Qc5 12. ex: Castling could have been weak here because of lining up the queen and rook. Black exploits it.
moves.16... Bxc4 17. Ba3 Qxd5 18. Qxd5 Bxd5 19: Possibly a better move would have been Ne5 for better position. It gets the knight involved in the attack.
A better move would be Kb4. The knight was protecting the pawn on f6.
moves.36... h5 37. Ne3 Be2 38. Ng2 Bf3 39. Ne1: c4 would have been better than a4 because it allow capture of the pawn.
